content.body: TabAtkins: Can you do a new pip release for Bikeshed? So I can get the https://github.com/tabatkins/bikeshed/pull/2134 change included
content.formatted_body: TabAtkins: Can you do a new pip release for Bikeshed? So I can get the https://github.com/tabatkins/bikeshed/pull/2134 change included

content.body: I do need an actual updated pip release to get that, right? Just doing `bikeshed update` doesn’t pull it in
content.formatted_body: I do need an actual updated pip release to get that, right? Just doing bikeshed update doesn’t pull it in

content.body: Do you auto-release an updated pip package on some schedule? I mean at some point after there’s been an update to the sources
No auto-release, I do it occasionally, and try to hit it a day or two after updates (partially to ensure I catch necessary changes like what happened ^_^). I'll take care of it tomorrow morning.
On my short list is moving the boilerplates over to being `bikeshed update`-able, so I don't need to release a new pip version just for that
content.formatted_body: On my short list is moving the boilerplates over to being bikeshed update-able, so I don't need to release a new pip version just for that

content.body: oh that would be very cool
It would also mean the boilerplates would be in sync with the other test files, and not require rebasing tests just to be updated.
ah yeah I guess the test rebasing thing is something that’s a bit confusing to Bikeshed code contributors
